summary:
KMD Brands Trading Update – Material Information

  • Sales Performance (unaudited, 10 months to May 2025):
  • Group Total Sales: -0.5% YoY
    • Rip Curl: +0.4% YoY (wholesale weak, direct-to-consumer strong)
    • Kathmandu: -1.0% YoY (weather-impacted, but +13.2% in June 25 YTD)
    • Oboz: -4.1% YoY (improving trends, online growth)

  • Online Sales: +10.7% YoY (Kathmandu new platform drove +26.1% post-May).

  • Gross Margin: Down 140 bps YoY due to competitive discounting.

  • US Tariff Impact: Estimated ~$1M FY25 EBITDA hit (uncertainty remains).

  • FY25 EBITDA Guidance: $15M–$25M (subject to winter/summer trade).

  • Net Debt Forecast (31 July 2025): ~$70M (inventory cautiously managed).

  • Banking Covenants: Amended for next two periods; expects compliance.

  • Investor Update: Strategic initiatives to be detailed at September Investor Day.

(Note: NZ$ figures unless stated.)

• Buy-back Type: On-market buy-back
  • Total Securities Bought Back (Previous Day): 37,570
  • Cumulative Buy-back (Before Previous Day): 155,439
  • Total Shares on Issue: 101,964,147
  • Buy-back Authorization: Up to 5% of shares (no guarantee of full execution)
  • Buy-back Period: 13/5/2025 to 29/4/2026
  • Previous Day Pricing:
  • Highest price paid: AUD 0.525
  • Lowest price paid: AUD 0.510
  • Total consideration: AUD 19,524.59
  • Highest ASX Permissible Price (Prev. Day): AUD 0.570

No other material information identified.

• Substantial Holder Movement Disclosure
  • Entity: Steven Newman & NMC Trustees Limited (NMC Investment Trust)
  • Security: EROAD Ltd (NZX: ERD) ordinary shares
  • Current Holdings:
    • Steven Newman: 5.347% (10,020,952 shares) – down from 7.290% in last disclosure.
    • NMC Trust: 5.257% (9,853,024 shares) – down from 7.195%.
  • Key Transaction:
    • NMC Trust sold 2,000,000 shares on 13 June 2025 for A$2.82m (on-market).
    • Cumulative sales since Feb 2024: 3,444,059 shares (reducing combined holding by ~2%).
  • Control Detail: Steven Newman retains indirect control over NMC Trust’s holdings (20%+ ownership).

Omitted: Minor holdings (<0.1%), legal boilerplate.

• Strategic Energy Reserve Term Sheet Signed: Genesis, Mercury, Meridian, and Contact signed a non-binding term sheet to maintain Huntly Power Station's Rankine Units (scheduled for retirement) to support national energy security until 2035.
  • Market Context: Driven by 2024 winter supply shortages (gas decline, low hydro/wind) and long-term gas supply concerns.
  • Key Timeline: Proposal aims for implementation by 1 January 2026; final certainty required by early November 2025 for operational planning.
  • Structure: 10-year commitment with potential biomass transition; remaining capacity to be offered via Huntly Firming Options.
  • Regulatory Engagement: Genesis has consulted the Commerce Commission on the proposal.

Omitted: Legal boilerplate, background on companies, routine operational details.
